image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Oregon; born in Eugene, Lane County, Oreg., June 15, 1917; graduated from Jefferson High School, Portland, Oreg.,1935; LL.B., University of Oregon, Eugene, Oreg.,1941; United States Marine Corps, 1942-1946; lawyer, private practice; chairman, Oregon State Republican Central committee, 1955-1957; elected simultaneously as a Republican to the Eighty-eighth and to the Eighty-ninth Congress by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Walter Norblad, and reelected to the four succeeding Congresses (November 3, 1964-January 3, 1975); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fourth Congress in 1974; died on January 28, 2009, in Portland, Oreg.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Wendell Wyatt, Republican Representative from Oregon. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

researchRecord.name: 1971-1973, 1 folder.
researchRecord.description: The papers include typescript letters to William W. Washburn from Edith Green, 1 p, January 18, 1971, Wendell Wyatt, 1 p, February 19, 1971, and photocopy typescript letter from Wayne Morse, 1 p, September 30, 1973, concerning Democratic Party politics, the FDA and the drug dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO).

researchRecord.name: In the Collection on the Goose Hollow, Portland, highrise controversy papers, 1971-1976, 1 folder.
In the Wendell Wyatt letters to Barbara Vatter papers, 1969, 1 folder.
researchRecord.description: The letters from Wendell Wyatt to Barbara Vatter, ca. 1969, acknowledge Vatter's letter regarding legislation to abolish the Committee on Un-American Activities and thank her for returning a questionnaire.

researchRecord.name: 1992, 110 pages.
researchRecord.description: An oral history interview with Wendell Wyatt conducted on January 28 and March 24, 1992 by Randall Weisberg. In the interview, Wendell Wyatt discusses his family background and personal history; his education and career in law and personnel and proceedings of the U. S. District Court of Oregon.

researchRecord.name: N.d., 1 photograph.
researchRecord.description: One (1) original black-and-white photograph of Wendell Wyatt on his election to Congress taken by Fabian Bachrach.

researchRecord.name: In the Tom McCall Photographs Collection, ca. 1905-1984, 4.07 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: People depicted include Bill Wyatt. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Steve Neal photographs collection, ca. 1965-1979, 0.16 cubic foot.
In the Photographs: WRO-WZ [graphic], n.d., amount unknown.
1965-1968. 45 feet.
researchRecord.description: Congressional papers. Inventory in library. Restricted.
